standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.

###Place Value  We can think in terms of hundredths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}9.19 - 7\\\\ &=9.19 - 7.00\\\\ &=919\text{ hundredths} - 700\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=219\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=2.19 \end{align}$

###Place value table  Let's line up the numbers by their decimal places.    Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  $\blueE{9}$ | $.$ | $\blueE{1}$ | $\blueE9$  $\maroonD7$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{0}$ | $\maroonD0$  Now, let's subtract each place value column.  | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  | $\blueE{9}$ | $.$ | $\blueE{1}$ | $\blueE{9}$ $-$ | $\maroonD7$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{0}$ | $\maroonD0$ | $\underline{~~~~}$|  | $\underline{~~~~}$| $\underline{~~~~}$  | $2$ | $.$| $1$ | $9$
There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.

###Place Value  We can think in terms of hundredths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}1.64 - 1\\\\ &=1.64 - 1.00\\\\ &=164\text{ hundredths} - 100\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=64\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=0.64 \end{align}$

###Place value table  Let's line up the numbers by their decimal places.    Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  $\blueE{1}$ | $.$ | $\blueE{6}$ | $\blueE4$  $\maroonD1$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{0}$ | $\maroonD0$  Now, let's subtract each place value column.  | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  | $\blueE{1}$ | $.$ | $\blueE{6}$ | $\blueE{4}$ $-$ | $\maroonD1$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{0}$ | $\maroonD0$ | $\underline{~~~~}$|  | $\underline{~~~~}$| $\underline{~~~~}$  | $0$ | $.$| $6$ | $4$
There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.
